context_meta.title: The priciest real estate rental in San Jose hits $8,500 per month
context_meta.summary: 1345 Kotenberg Ave.  This single-family home is located at 1345 Kotenberg Ave., within walking distance to downtown Willow Glen. At 3,300-square-feet, it has four bedrooms and four bathrooms and is listed at $8,500 per month. For comparison, the average four-bedroom rental in San Jose is approximately $3,750 per month. The executive victorian is furnished and features vaulted ceilings and an open floor plan.The downstairs master suite includes a walk-in closet and whirlpool tub. The home has a mix of hardwood floors and carpeting, gourmet kitchen, washer/dryer laundry and a fireplace. Pets not allowed. (Check out the complete listing here.) 1665 Emory St.  This single-family home at 1665 Emory

context_meta.title: Sharks swamp Devils, 6-2
context_meta.summary: Barclay Goodrow had a goal and an assist, and Brent Burns furnished three helpers as the San Jose Sharks hammered the visiting New Jersey Devils 6-2 on Tuesday night. The Sharks posted their fifth consecutive win, gaining a stronger grip on second place in the Pacific Division. San Jose has won eight of its past 10 games.

context_meta.title: San Jose: Authorities identify pair killed in Communications Hill crash
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE — The Santa Clara County Medical Examiner-Coroner's Office has identified two people killed in a car crash on Communications Hill last week as 22-year-old Brandon Gomez Hunsperger and 15-year-old Isabelle Gonzalez, both of San Jose. The collision occurred on the 200 block of Casselino Drive about 1:30 a.m. Friday, when Hunsperger lost control of the Honda Accord he was driving and hit a tree, according to police. Hunsperger and Gonzalez were pronounced dead at the scene, marking the 13th and 14th traffic fatalities of 2018 in San Jose. A second female passenger was taken to a hospital with life-threatening injuries, and a male passenger was transported with injuries that were not considered

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Team of the Week: Graham Zusi shines in defeat of San Jose
context_meta.summary: His stunning golazo may have stolen the headlines — and fairly so — but it was a comprehensive performance from Sporting Kansas City right back Graham Zusi that has landed him a spot on MLSsoccer.com's Team of the Week. In addition to finding the top corner with a brilliant long-range blast in the second half of Saturday's 3-2 win over the San Jose Earthquakes, Zusi led all players with three chances created and 86 touches. He also made five interceptions and won seven duels as Sporting KC moved into a tie for first place atop the Western Conference. context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Pizarro: Robert F. Kennedy's 1968 San Jose speech to be commemorated
context_meta.summary: About a week after announcing his candidacy for president in 1968, U.S. Sen. Robert F. Kennedy paid a visit to San Jose — part of a long day that also took him to Sacramento and Stockton. He was greeted by some 2,000 people at the airport when he arrived on the afternoon of March 23 and drew a crowd of about 10,000 for a speech at downtown's St. James Park. Kennedy was assassinated in Los Angeles less than three months later, and a memorial forum was installed at the park in his honor in 1970. That's where a coalition of San Jose community groups will commemorate the 50th anniversary of his visit on March 24 , reflecting on the beloved politician and his legacy. San Jose City Councilman Raul

context_meta.title: Hwy 101 School Bus Crash Injures At Least 4: San Jose Fire
context_meta.summary: SANTA CLARA VALLEY, CA — A school bus was involved in a crash — possibly a hit-and-run — Thursday on U.S. Highway 101 in San Jose, according to the California Highway Patrol. The bus was carrying some 32 children when the collision happened at about 10:07 a.m. on the northbound 101 connector to northbound Interstate Highway 880, CHP dispatchers reported. San Jose Fire Department personnel responded to the scene south of Oakland Road and were treating at least four patients for minor injuries, fire Capt. Mitch Matlow said. context_meta.summary: The Sharks lost Marc-Edouard Vlasic and Melker Karlsson to injury, but still gutted out a big win in Vancouver on the second night of a back-to-back.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Meier scores winner as Sharks beat Canucks 5-3
context_meta.summary: VANCOUVER, British Columbia (AP) The San Jose Sharks were able to pull out a win despite struggling to shake the Vancouver Canucks. Timo Meier's second goal of the game snapped a third-period tie and the Sharks won 5-3 on Saturday night for their fourth consecutive victory. Logan Couture and Kevin Labanc each had a goal and an assist, and Tomas Hertl scored into an empty net with 25 seconds remaining for the Sharks, who are 7-2-0 in their last nine games. ''We weren't at our best,'' said Couture, who also had an assist. ''They're a team in a position where they are rebuilding, but they played hard. They gave us a challenge. It was tough, but we gutted out the win.'' Nikolay Goldobin, Alex Edler

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: San Jose lags on affordable housing as home prices soar beyond $1 million
context_meta.summary: Like most cities across the state, San Jose lags far behind on its goals to add badly needed affordable housing. Last year, the nation's 10th largest city issued building permits for just 475 affordable units — 20 percent of its target number for the year. During the same time, the city allowed 2,622 homes to be built at the market rate — now north of a million dollars for a single-family home — reaching 162 percent of its goal for the year. The numbers are part of the city's latest annual housing report, which comes as calls for affordable housing in San Jose reach a crescendo amid ever-rising housing costs and the news that Google — the tech giant that some local residents have blamed for driving up the cost of living — is planning to build a massive development near Diridon Station.

context_meta.title: Southwest Offers New Nonstop From San Jose To Cabo
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE, CA — Southwest Airlines and San Jose city leaders celebrated an inaugural nonstop flight to Cabo San Lucas with festivities at Mineta San Jose International Airport on Saturday. Airport and airline staff worked to decorate the gate area and get passengers involved in the excitement with bright photo booth frames, balloons and signs that said "Hola amigos" and "Viva Mexico." The once-weekly Cabo flight will depart from San Jose each Saturday at 8:45 a.m. and return at 2:05 p.m., according to airport officials. "We're thrilled to continue our 25-year partnership with Southwest Airlines by launching the carrier's first-ever international service from SJC to Cabo San Lucas, a top-requested

context_meta.title: Sporting KC looks for improvement at home vs. San Jose
context_meta.summary: Sporting Kansas City had a mostly hard-and-fast mode of operations in 2017. SKC was pretty much unbeatable at home (10-1-6), giving up more than one goal at home just once in 17 games. On the road, Sporting struggled, going 2-8-7, scoring just nine goals on the road in 17 games.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: San Jose teachers union building hit by Molotov cocktail, official says
context_meta.summary: A Molotov cocktail was hurled at a teachers union building in East San Jose earlier this week, an official said, adding to a string of instances over the past couple of months where suspected vandals have inflicted damage on the site. The fiery incident was reported Tuesday at 5:47 p.m. at the building in the 800 block of South Capitol Avenue, which houses the Mt. Hamilton chapter of the California Teachers Association and the Alum Rock Educators Association. Jocelyn Merz, president of the Alum Rock union, said it appears that someone threw a Molotov cocktail — a World War II-era incendiary device typically consisting of a glass bottle of fuel and a soaked cloth for a fuse — onto the roof of the building.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Fehr's 1st goal for Sharks helps fuel 5-3 win over Red Wings
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE, Calif. (AP) The San Jose Sharks ended their longest homestand of the season on a high note and now look to carry that forward on the road as they seek to solidify a playoff berth. Eric Fehr scored his first goal with San Jose and the Sharks closed a six-game homestand by handing the Detroit Red Wings their seventh straight loss, 5-3 on Monday night. ''We understood that if we win this game it would be a pretty successful homestand,'' said captain Joe Pavelski, who had two assists. Joonas Donskoi, Kevin Labanc and Timo Meier also scored to help the Sharks win for the fourth time on the homestand and remain in second place in the Pacific Division with a two-point lead over Los Angeles.

context_meta.title: Video: San Jose: 12-year-old girl injured in hit-and-run
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE — Authorities are searching for a motorist who hit a 12-year-old girl in a crosswalk and drove off. Captured on surveillance camera, the collision occurred about 8:45 a.m. Monday at 17th and Julian streets, said Sgt. Enrique Garcia of the San Jose Police Department. The footage shows a brown late 1990s to early 2000s Toyota Camry turning from southbound 17th onto eastbound Julian and hitting the girl as she walks north across Julian in a crosswalk. The impact knocks the girl to the ground. The Toyota stops but drives off seconds later. The girl was taken to a hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, according to Garcia. context_meta.title: Offices, housing may sprout by San Jose train stop
context_meta.summary: SAN JOSE — A realty firm has proposed development of a big office building and hundreds of residential units that would become a transit village perched along a light rail line in San Jose. Bay West Development is eyeing a project that would consist of 447 residential units and 200,000 square feet of office space on a triangle-shaped lot near the corner of South Bascom Avenue and Southwest Expressway, and adjacent to the Bascom light rail station. “For us, it's critical to have a rail stop,” said Pete Beritzhoff, a partner with Bay West Development. “For both residential and office development, it's becoming more and more important that mixed-use sites are on a rail line.” Beritzhoff noted the

The company will alert developers the following afternoon.  The company announced in a press release that it will also be opening the show up to 350 “Student Scholarships” for the 29th annual event. context_meta.title: Spend a 'Paranormal Evening' with Alice Cooper in San Jose
context_meta.summary: Shock-rock icon Alice Cooper is hitting the road again. He's announced dates for his latest trek, dubbed A Paranormal Evening with Alice Cooper.” The tour includes a stop on Aug. 14 at the City National Civic in San Jose. Tickets are $49.50-$69.50 and go on sale at 10 a.m. March 16, www.ticketmaster.com. Cooper is supporting his 27th album, “Paranormal,” which features such guests as “U2's Larry Mullen, Jr., who plays on 9 of the 12 new songs; Billy Gibbons of ZZ Top; and Deep Purple's Roger Glover, as well as a highly anticipated mini-reunion of the original Alice Cooper band members,” according to a news release. context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: An explosion, fire and rescue in San Jose
context_meta.summary: VIDEO: Aftermath of explosion and fire near San Jose's Rose Garden neighborhood. SAN JOSE – Chad Collins heard an explosion Saturday morning and rushed out of his house in West San Jose. The home across the street smoldered, the walls cracked and the roof was partially collapsed. He spotted his neighbor, a woman in her 70s, moaning and crawling through the rubble inside her home. Collins pushed through a crack in the walls, grabbed the woman and guided her from the house. Less than a minute later, the yellow stucco home on the 2100 block of Bel Air Avenue was engulfed in flames. “I'm not a hero,” Collins, 25, said on Sunday “I'm just the dumb guy who went in.” The blast ripped through the quiet

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Grubauer's 24 saves lead Capitals past Sharks 2-0
context_meta.summary: On a road trip where Washington struggled to generate any offense, Nicklas Backstrom's goal was enough to send the Capitals home on a good note. Philipp Grubauer made 24 saves for his fifth career shutout and Backstrom broke a scoreless tie late in the second period to help the Capitals salvage the final game of their California swing with a 2-0 victory over the San Jose Sharks on Saturday. Washington was outscored 7-1 in losses to Anaheim and Los Angeles to open the trip before a narrow win in San Jose moved the Capitals one point ahead of Pittsburgh for first place in the Metropolitan Division, pending the Penguins' game in Toronto later.

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Capitals salvage road trip, shut out Sharks
context_meta.summary: Nicklas Backstrom scored late in the second period, and Lars Eller added another goal late in the third while goalie Philipp Grubauer made 24 saves as the Washington Capitals defeated the San Jose Sharks 2-0 on Saturday in San Jose. This ended a three-game Western swing where Washington simply could not find a lot of offense. The Capitals fell at Anaheim on Tuesday (4-0) and then lost to the Kings (3-1) on Thursday night.
